IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To educate, create awareness, promote the interest of humanity in the cause of justice & the suppression of all forms of cruelty to animals.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO EDUCATE, CREATE AWARENESS, PROMOTE THE INTEREST OF HUMANITY IN THE CASE OF JUSTICE & THE SUPPRESSION OF ALL FORMS OF CRUELTY TO ANIMALS, TO ALLEVIATE SUFFERING, CONSERVE AND PROTECT ANIMALS IN THEIR ENVIRONMENT.
IRS990.Desc: Animal Rescue, Relocation and Maintenance: rescue of abandoned animals from the circus, entertainment industries, wildlife trade and animal experimentation laboratories. These animals are commonly rescued after a campaign of awareness and education by Animal Defenders International, Inc., U.S.. When governments, such as South America ban the use of animals in circuses Animal Defenders International, Inc., U.S. assists with relocation of the animals into sanctuaries and then provides support for those sanctuaries to maintain the rescued animals by providing medical treatment, nutrition and a forever home.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Additional programs are in the form of Campaigns, Education, and Awareness: Including production of education and awareness materials such as leaflets, detailed technical reports, other publications, and videos. The materials support publicizing campaigns across the media infiltrating educational establishments, local, state and national government. The materials not only provide scientific research to support the campaigns, they facilitate investigations of animal abuse and, where appropriate, government agencies with prosecution and legal action.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Animal Defenders International, Inc., U.S. is a nonprofit organization and is exempt from federal and state income tax liability; no provision is made for current or deferred income taxes. The organization uses the same accounting method for tax and financial reporting. GAAP provides accounting and disclosure guidance about positions taken by an entity in its tax returns that might be uncertain. Management has considered its tax positions and believes that all of the positions taken in its federal and state exempt organization tax returns are more likely than not to be sustained upon examination. The organization's returns are subject to examination by federal and state taxing authorities, generally for three and four years, respectively, after they are filed.

Records are maintained in the accounting database and also in the campaign/rescue department. We are not providing general grants to any entities and only providing support to other entities for care and maintenance of our rescued animals, mainly sanctuaries.
Please describe how the organization annually monitors compliance with their conflict of interest policy: Individual informal review of insiders and related top management.

Describe the compensation of executive director, other top management official, other officers or key employees: This is being done periodically by the board of directors with the help of the executive director with current information and market review. Board of Directors, (majority of which includeds non-executive directors) approve all the payments to officers, key employees, CEO, Executive Director and top management.

Describe the procedures which you have in place to ensure that the Board of Directors (or a portion thereof) reviews the organization's Form 990 before it is filed with the Internal Revenue Service: The 990 form will be first reviewed by the CFO and then by the President of the Board of Directors before it is filed with the Internal Revenue Service.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART VI SECTION A GOVERNING BODY AND MANAGEMENT
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Please list out all insiders of the organization who are related to each other or to any independent contractors through family or business relationships: Timothy Phillps (Vice President/Director) and Jan creamer (President/Director) are related by marriage. Nick Brice (Director) and Amanda Brice (Director) are related by marriage.
ANIMAL DEFENDERS INTERNAIONAL UK SHARE THE SAME BOARD MEMBERS.

ADI FILMS, LLC IS A SINGLE MEMBER LLC, WHOLLY OWNED BY ANIMAL DEFENDERS INTERNATIONAL, INC. THE TWO COMPANIES SHARE A FACILITY AND EMPLOYEES. ADI FILMS, LLC IS CONSOLIDATED WITH THE ORGANIZATION FOR TAX AND FINANCIAL PURPOSES.
